frame.name: Commerce_buy
frame.definition: <def-root>These are words describing a basic commercial transaction involving a <fen>Buyer</fen> and a <fen>Seller</fen> exchanging <fen>Money</fen> and <fen>Goods</fen>, taking the perspective of the <fen>Buyer</fen>. The words vary individually in the patterns of frame element realization they allow. For example, the typical pattern for the verb BUY: <fen>Buyer</fen> buys <fen>Goods</fen> from <fen>Seller</fen> for <fen>Money</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Buyer">Abby</fex> bought <fex name="Goods">a car</fex> <fex name="Seller">from Robin</fex> <fex name="Money">for $5,000</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Buyer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen> wants the <fen>Goods</fen> and offers <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for them. <ex><fex name="Buyer">Jess</fex> <t>bought</t> a coat.</ex> <ex><fex name="Buyer">Lee</fex> <t>bought</t> a textbook from Abby.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction. <ex> Only one winner <t>purchased</t> <fex name="Gds">the paintings</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> by which a commercial transaction occurs. <ex> Will they allow you to <t>purchase</t> <fex name="Mns">by check</fex>? </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction. <ex>Sam <t>bought</t> the car <fex name="Money">for $12,000</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex> Jon <t>bought</t> some expensive apples <fex name="Rate">at five dollars a pound</fex>! </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Seller
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>. <ex>Most of my audio equipment, I <t>purchased</t> <fex name="Seller">from a department store near my apartment</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. <ex>Lee <t>buys</t> potatoes <fex name="Unit">by the pound</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> for which an event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the purchasing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Buyer</fen> that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>She <fex name="Manner">gleefully</fex> <t>bought</t> the rock.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Recipient
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual intended by the <fen>Buyer</fen> to receive the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>You <t>bought</t> <fex name="Recipient">me</fex> three pairs already!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the commerce event began to be repeated to when it stopped. <ex>I have been <t>buying</t> from him <fex name="iter">for over 10 years</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Imposed_purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>I <t>purchased</t> the calculator<fex name="Imposed_purpose">for easier calculation of my debts</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: buy.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: obtain in exchange for payment

lexUnit.name: buyer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or company who purchases something

lexUnit.name: purchaser.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person or company who buys something

lexUnit.name: client.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: The person paying for services (or in some cases, goods). This term is used in preference to customer or buyer in transactions for services, especially in situations where the providers are lawyers, financial advisors, architects, agents for performers and professional atheletes, etc.
